title: CARRYING LOW ELO: MID or ADC?
body:
I am in Bronze 2 at the moment (haha bronzie scrub yeah I know)
and I can't make up my mind between ADC or Mid to start maining.
I really like the recognition and the role of ADC, but it can be stressing.
 I also like midding, but its forever getting contested and picked.
So my question is to you guys, if you were very good with both roles equally, what role would be easier to carry games?
you may choose both if you believe so, and state your reasons why!

I don't believe in ELO hell, but I don't know anyone that has actually climbed solo que to diamond as adc only by themselves.

replies.body:
Duo queue with a friend who plays support

Or mid

Never soloqueue ADC if you're more interested in carrying than having faith in a stranger and playing as a team.

If you're playing ranked, you shouldn't have a 'main'. You should be prepared to fill and have a couple of core champions that you can fill in each of those lanes. If everyone wanted to simply main a lane or two, then more probable than not, every game would start with two or three people fighting or unhappy with the lane they've been forced into, because they wanted mid and they wanted to carry. Learn to fill, and games will be more enjoyable, cooperative and sometimes you'll get mid or adc, or someone else will fill and you'll get your pick. If you're smart, you'll main support, because if you call fill, 70% of the time, you'll be support because no one thinks you can carry with support. Oh how wrong they are…

As for mid or adc, and which carries games more? Well any role can carry. It's not about getting kills, it's about carrying with team work. That means vision, ganks, objective control… ADC and Mid just usually get the credit and most kills, but I've seen a mid Lee Sin with 40 kills lose, and Kats going 23/1 have to surrender in 20.

What I'm trying to say is that carrying through low ELO isn't about lanes. It's about you and how much you help your team. Every lane can carry. It's up to you. I'd personally stop thinking about what lanes you want, and what others want. When you can learn to carry from anywhere, that's when you'll truly understand.
Learn to fill and make the team environment friendly and co-operative. Will help you significantly more than leaning a carry role.

I main ADC but i do branch out into Support top and some jungle, I think as an ADC your support is the one who is going to set up the plays and allow you to get ahead, otherwise you should just be getting farm and trying to poke out the others so its kinda stagnant and unless your support is good it is hard to get ahead and ruin the enemy, mid on the other hand is the lane that .. if they get fed carries the game and just s**ts all over the adc and any squishy champions this is the lane of just fighting it out and farming, I think it is more fun than most other rolls but I never play it because I suck at AP farming, in most of my bronze games if the jungler ganks mid lots and gets them ahead then that team has a higher chance of winning, That being said I have played 14 ranked games as taric and only lost 2 of them so if you are wanting to play support and make plays for your ADC to snowball off then that is a very good roll a bit like jungle, a good jungle or support can really impact the game more so than some ADC or mids depending on how much they roam and play smart. I think just play what you are best at, like I am not very good at playing mid but I am good at ADC and I don't mean like good at as in you have played a lot of games in that roll, I mean that it almost just comes naturally to you. Good Luck

I'd say ADC is probably the hardest role to carry with consistently in bronze. Assassins tend to be picked and get fed pretty often in low ratings, and even a good adc player will have a tough time dealing with a super fed assassin, especially since you should never expect your teammates to know how to protect you in bronze. 
Mid is a good role to carry from but like you said, its super popular, so you'd probably be lucky to get it in half your games and will need to be adept at other roles too.
If you're looking to main only one role I'd honestly say that any of the other 3 roles are better.

>I don't know anyone that has actually climbed solo que to diamond as adc only by themselves

How about, I don't know, almost every LCS ADC? If you watch their streams a lot of ADC mains just ADC their way up to Master on their smurfs.

In lower (but still Diamond) Elo, check out "Loserfruit" on Twitch (OCE streamer). She soloQ's as ADC only (unless role taken) and makes it to Diamond.

Truth is, you can climb to Diamond with any role. Yes, even support. In fact, the higher Elo you get, the more support mains you encounter, since support is the least-effort way to climb.

And no, you can't claim that this is only because "ADCs are competent in higher Elo" - I myself climbed from Bronze V to high Silver playing support only when I first learned the game a couple years ago (now I'm high Plat and fill any role, but I don't play much atm).
Thanks man, you've gave me some self-belief. ( if that's a word)

Believe it or not, it generally varies by patch as to which carries harder.

And right now it's jungle or top lane that carry the most, followed by NON CRIT based ADC's, then mid, then crit based ADC's (because all they need to screw them over is a randuin's.).
Interesting about non crit based adcs. If focus and peel is on point them should not be an issue but it would explain a few things.

I am just a bronze 3 so you don't have to notice me but I believe it is easier mid laning to climb. I also believe (witnessed with my brother) when someone tries to carry as an adc they get really mad and end up being one of them trolls and throw games for no reason. 

Also if you can play yasuo mid, easy silver.
